Here's the actual timeline:


https://sportstar.thehindu.com/olympics/paris-2024/news/vinesh-phogat-antim-panghal-53kg-paris-2024-olympics-selection-trial-explain-wfi-timeline-ioa-ad-hoc-committee/article68500511.ece



March 7, 2024:Â The Delhi High Court â€“ acting on a plea by some prominent wrestlers including Bajrang Punia, Vinesh and Sakshi Malik â€“ rules on March 7 that the IOA-appointed ad-hoc committee would conduct the trials. The ad-hoc committee had fixed the dates for selection trials for the Asian Championships and Asian Olympic Games qualifier in Bishkek for March 10 and 11 in Sonepat (men) and Patiala (women). Earlier, after the WFIâ€™s suspension was lifted by UWW on February 13, the national body had also announced the same dates for trials in Delhi.

March 8, 2024:Â UWW makes it clearÂ that it would receive entries only from its affiliated national body, theÂ Wrestling Federation of IndiaÂ and not the IOA-appointed ad-hoc committee.

March 9, 2024:Â After UWWâ€™s communication, the ad-hoc committee â€“ which had earlier decided to consider only the wrestlers who had competed in the National Championships conducted by it in Jaipur apart from some wrestlers who performed well in 2022 and 2023 for the trials â€“ and the WFIÂ prepare a combined listÂ for the trials, and included participants from the WFI-organised Pune Nationals, earlier not recognised by the Government.

The ad-hoc committee, based on the WFIâ€™s amended 2022 Selection Policy, decides that the top four wrestlers in every class would compete among themselves on June 10 in order to determine a challenger for the Olympic-quota winners to pick the final Olympic squad.

March 11, 2024:Â Vinesh, expressing doubts about WFIâ€™s commitment to hold a selection trial on a later day,Â insisted on participating in two weight categoriesÂ -- 50 and 53kg. The ad-hoc committee, making an exception, allowed Vinesh to compete in both categories upon the laterâ€™s insistence.

She won the trials in 50kg, earning the right to compete at the Asian Olympic qualifiers in Bishkek. She needed to reach the semifinals of the womenâ€™s 53kg category to feature in the top four to challenge Antim at a later date.Â Vinesh offered no defence in her 10-0 loss to Anju in the semifinals since her purpose of competing at the trials was already accomplished.

March 18, 2024:Â IOA dissolves the ad-hoc committee, saying â€œthere is no further needâ€ for it to continue after revocation of the suspension on the national federation by UWW.

April 20, 2024:Â Vinesh wins quota in 50kg for Paris 2024 during the Asian Olympic Qualifiers in Bishkek.

April 24, 2024:Â â€œAfter the Istanbul event (World Olympic Games Qualifiers), we will decide whether to conduct trials for the Olympics. The selection committee will decide that. The selection rule says we should have trials. Hope trials will be conducted before sending the team,â€ WFI PresidentÂ Sanjay Singh tells SportstarÂ on the sidelines of the Federation Cup in Varanasi.

May 15, 2024:Â â€œBy the time trials are finished, the Olympics will be almost there, so when do we start preparations? In my opinion, trials should not be held,â€Â Aman Sehrawat, the quota-winner in menâ€™s 57kg, tells PTIÂ when asked about the trials to decide the final squad for Olympics.

May 15, 2024:Â Vinesh criticises WFI for not not providing information about the final selection trials format, â€œincluding the date, time and venueâ€ with three months left for the Paris Olympics.

May 17, 2024:Â â€œWe need mental peace before the Olympics. Already two months is too less a period to prepare. At this stage, every single day counts. We plan our training on a weekly basis and if I am called to India for trials, it will disrupt plans and affect medal chances,â€Â Anshu Malik, the quota-winner in womenâ€™s 57kg, tells PTIÂ while training in Tokyo.

May 17, 2024:Â â€œI am still recovering from the weight-cut at the qualifiers. If we undergo trials again, it will affect our body. We have to complete with elite wrestlers and need to plan well. But if keep thinking about trials, how will we strategise,â€Â Nisha Dahiya, the quota-winner in womenâ€™s 68kg, tells PTI.

May 17, 2024:Â â€œIt takes us about seven days to reduce weight and almost a similar time to recover after competition. If I have to again start the procedure, itâ€™s a huge challenge. We should not be subjected to the trials,â€Â Â Reetika Hooda, the quota-winner in womenâ€™s 76kg category, tells PTI.

May 21, 2024:Â The seven-member WFI selection committee unanimously decides not to hold trials, therefore allowing the quota-winners to compete in the Paris Olympics.

â€œFive wrestlers (except Vinesh) had written to the WFI requesting exemption from trials. The selection committee decided not to conduct the trials and send the quota winners to Paris,â€Â WFI president Sanjay Singh tells PTI.
